description.narrative:
At Oxfam level, the project was designed in alignment to two Oxfam regional programs, Extractive Industries and Water Governance, which are now integrated to embody the Asia#s Regional Natural Resources Program Cluster, and within our Oxfam InternationalStrategicPlan, The Power of People Against Poverty (2013 # 2019). The project contributes to Oxfam International strategic goal # 1, #4 and #5 of the 6 strategic goals. # Goal 1: The Right to be Heard # People claiming their right to a better life, # Goal 4: Sustainable food and # Goal 5: Fair sharing of natural resources among the 6 Oxfam strategic goals.
PEM III#s focus and scope is well aligned with Oxfam Mekong Regional Water Governance#s priorities and strategies for the next five years, whichinclude providing direct supportto riverine communities in the Mekong and 3S. Those priorities and strategies that guide PEM III project include: # PROMOTING GOOD GOVERNANCE # the project focuses on strengthening communities# rights to protect and manage their own resources. The change will bring are community rights respected, accountable to, transparent, FPIC, laws strengthened. The changes will be brought about by raising community voices including those from the marginalized groups, gender and womenleadership, regional networks, complaint mechanisms, review regulations, community recognition and decentralizations. # PROMOTING STANDARDS <(>&<)> SAFEGUARDS - the project building on the previous two phase of PEM 1 and 2 and continue strengthen community#scapacity and voice that impact directly to social and environmental considerations in the decision making for water infrastructure projects so that the development does not harm communities, and the water ecosystems.

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Social Research and Development (CSRD) is a local non-government organization which is registered with the Hue Union of Science and Technology Associations (HUSTA). CSRD has been registered and operated since 2008. CSRD is based in Hue in the Central Region of Vietnam, and many of the projects have been located in the provinces of Central Region. CSRD also works throughout Vietnam and more broadly in South East Asia on water resources issues because CSRD is the administration centre for the Vietnam Rivers Network (VRN). The CSRD mission is to work towards a better life for all people in Vietnam, particularly for those who are poor and vulnerable, and adversely impacted by Vietnam#s industrial development. The hydropower industry is a current focus because many power plants are planned and many are already operating. CSRD#s approach is to work in partnership with local communities and grass roots groups, and to bring communities together so that they may learn from each other. The organization#s work has been recognized by local and provincial authorities and by the National Union of Science and Technology Associations. CSRD maintains very good relationships with community partners; and has a positive record for achieving specific project outcomes.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
